airbnb_listing_details.description: Get detailed information about a specific Airbnb listing. Provide direct links to the user.

airbnb_search.description: Search for listings based on location and filters.

parameters.city: City to search for (for example, San Francisco, New York City) - required
parameters.country_code: 2-letter country code (for example, US, CA, GB) - defaults to US

airtable_describe_table.description: Gets detailed information about a specific table. Useful for getting details about a single table without fetching all tables in the base.

parameters.base_id: The ID of the Airtable base
parameters.table_id: The ID of the table to describe
parameters.detail_level: The amount of detail to get about the table (tableIdentifiersOnly, identifiersOnly, or full)

airtable_get_record.description: Gets a specific record by ID.

parameters.base_id: The ID of the Airtable base
parameters.record_id: The ID of the record to retrieve
parameters.table_id: The ID of the table (optional, table_name takes priority)

airtable_list_records.description: Lists records from a specified Airtable table.

parameters.base_id: The ID of the Airtable base
parameters.max_records: Maximum number of records to return (optional)

airtable_list_tables.description: Lists all tables in a specific base.

parameters.base_id: The ID of the Airtable base
parameters.detail_level: The amount of detail to get about the tables (tableIdentifiersOnly, identifiersOnly, or full)

airtable_search_records.description: Search for records containing a specific value in a field.

parameters.base_id: The ID of the Airtable base
parameters.field_name: The name of the field to search in

apartment_get_apartment_details.description: Get apartment details for a given apartment id.

parameters.apartment_id: Apartment id to get details for

apartment_list_all_apartments.description: List all apartments in the catalog.

apartment_save_apartment.description: Save an apartment to favorites if not already saved; otherwise do nothing.

apartment_search_apartments.description: Search for apartments based on multiple filters.

parameters.name: Name of the apartment
parameters.floor_level: Ground floor, Upper floors, Penthouse, Basement
parameters.pet_policy: Pets allowed, No pets, Cats allowed, Dogs allowed
parameters.lease_term: Month-to-month, 6 months, 1 year, Long term lease
parameters.saved_only: If true, search only saved apartments; if false, search all apartments (default)

brave-search_brave_local_search.description: Searches for local businesses and places using Brave's Local Search API. Best for queries related to physical locations, businesses, restaurants, services, etc.

brave-search_brave_web_search.description: Performs a web search using the Brave Search API, ideal for general queries, news, articles, and online content.

parameters.count: Number of results to return (maximum 20 per request)

calendar_get_all_tags.description: Get all tags from the calendar.

calendar_get_calendar_event.description: Read a calendar event from the calendar.

parameters.event_id: ID of the event to read

calendar_get_calendar_events_by_tag.description: Get calendar events from the calendar by tag.

calendar_get_calendar_events_from_to.description: Get calendar events that have any time overlap with the specified date range (excludes events that only touch at boundaries).

parameters.limit: Maximum number of events to return

calendar_read_today_calendar_events.description: Read today's calendar events from the calendar.

calendar_search_events.description: Searches for calendar events based on a query string. Searches partial matches in title, description, location, and attendees.

city_get_api_call_count.description: Get the current API call count for the service.

city_get_api_call_limit.description: Get the API call limit rate for the service.

city_get_crime_rate.description: Get crime rate for a given zip code. This free API has a call limit.

parameters.zip_code: Zip code to get crime rate for

cli-mcp-server_run_command.description: Allows command (CLI) execution in the directory /data. Available commands: ls, cat, find. Shell operators disabled unless ALLOW_SHELL_OPERATORS=true.

cli-mcp-server_show_security_rules.description: Show what commands and operations are allowed in this environment.

contacts_add_new_contact.description: Adds a new contact to the contacts app.

parameters.gender: Gender of the contact (Male, Female, Other, Unknown), optional, default Unknown
parameters.city_living: City where the contact is living (optional)
parameters.country: Country where the contact is living (optional)
parameters.status: Status of the contact (Student, Employed, Unemployed, Retired, Unknown), optional, default Unknown

contacts_delete_contact.description: Deletes a specific contact by contact_id.

parameters.contact_id: ID of the contact to delete

contacts_edit_contact.description: Edits specific fields of a contact by contact_id.

parameters.contact_id: ID of the contact to edit
parameters.updates: Dictionary of updates to apply to the contact

contacts_get_contact.description: Gets a specific contact by contact_id.

parameters.contact_id: ID of the contact to retrieve

contacts_get_contacts.description: Gets the list of contacts starting from a specified offset. There is a view limit.

parameters.offset: Starting point to retrieve contacts from, default is 0

contacts_get_current_user_details.description: Gets the current user's details including name, phone, email, nationality, and country.

contacts_search_contacts.description: Searches for contacts based on a query string in first name, last name, phone, and email.

crm_get_company.description: Retrieve a company by its unique ID.

parameters.id: The unique identifier of the company

crm_get_contact.description: Retrieve a contact by their unique ID.

parameters.id: The unique identifier of the contact

crm_get_deal.description: Retrieve a deal by its unique ID.

parameters.id: The unique identifier of the deal

crm_get_lead.description: Retrieve a lead by its unique ID.

parameters.id: The unique identifier of the lead

crm_list_engagements.description: List all engagements with optional filtering by contact_ids and/or company_ids.

parameters.contact_ids: Array of contact IDs to filter by (optional)
parameters.company_ids: Array of company IDs to filter by (optional)

crm_search_companies.description: Search companies by name using case-insensitive partial matching.

parameters.name: String to search for in company name (required)

crm_search_contacts.description: Search contacts by full name using case-insensitive partial matching.

parameters.full_name: String to search for in contact's full name (required)

crm_search_deals.description: Search deals by dealname and/or company_id using partial matching.

parameters.dealname: String to search for in deal's name (optional)

crm_search_leads.description: Search leads by full_name and/or company_id using partial matching.

parameters.full_name: String to search for in lead's full name (optional)

desktop-commander_create_directory.description: Create a new directory or ensure a directory exists. Can create nested directories; only within allowed directories.

parameters.path: Absolute path of directory to create

desktop-commander_edit_block.description: Apply surgical text replacements to files. Best for small, focused edits.

parameters.file_path: Path to the file to edit

desktop-commander_force_terminate.description: Force terminate a running terminal session.

desktop-commander_get_config.description: Get the complete server configuration as JSON.

desktop-commander_get_file_info.description: Retrieve detailed metadata about a file or directory.

parameters.path: Absolute path to file or directory

desktop-commander_get_usage_stats.description: Get usage statistics for debugging and analysis.

desktop-commander_give_feedback_to_deskt.description: Open feedback form in browser to provide feedback about Desktop Commander.

desktop-commander_interact_with_process.description: Send input to a running process and automatically receive the response. Primary tool for local file analysis via REPL.

parameters.wait_for_prompt: Whether to wait for prompt detection (boolean)

desktop-commander_kill_process.description: Terminate a running process by PID.

desktop-commander_list_directory.description: Get a detailed listing of all files and directories in a specified path.

desktop-commander_move_file.description: Move or rename files and directories within allowed directories.

desktop-commander_read_file.description: Read the contents of a file or URL with optional offset and length.

parameters.path: Absolute path to file, or URL if isUrl is true
parameters.isUrl: Boolean indicating path is a URL
parameters.offset: Start line offset (can be negative for tail)
parameters.length: Maximum number of lines to read

desktop-commander_read_multiple_files.description: Read the contents of multiple files simultaneously.

desktop-commander_read_process_output.description: Read output from a running process with intelligent completion detection.

desktop-commander_search_code.description: Search for text/code patterns within file contents using ripgrep.

desktop-commander_search_files.description: Find files by name using case-insensitive substring matching.

desktop-commander_set_config_value.description: Set a specific configuration value by key.

desktop-commander_start_process.description: Start a new terminal process with intelligent state detection. Primary tool for file analysis and data processing.

desktop-commander_write_file.description: Write or append to file contents, in chunks of 25â€“30 lines.

email_delete_email.description: Deletes an email by moving it to the TRASH folder.

parameters.email_id: ID of the email to delete
parameters.folder_name: Folder containing the email (INBOX, SENT, DRAFT, TRASH), defaults to INBOX

email_forward_email.description: Forwards an email to new recipients.

parameters.email_id: ID of the email to forward
parameters.recipients: Recipients to forward the email to
parameters.content: Additional content to add to the forwarded email
parameters.folder_name: Folder containing the original email, defaults to INBOX

email_get_email_by_id.description: Gets an email by its ID from the specified folder.

parameters.email_id: ID of the email to retrieve
parameters.folder_name: Folder to search (INBOX, SENT, DRAFT, TRASH), defaults to INBOX

email_get_email_by_index.description: Gets an email by its index from the specified folder.

parameters.idx: Index of the email to retrieve
parameters.folder_name: Folder to search (INBOX, SENT, DRAFT, TRASH), defaults to INBOX

email_list_emails.description: Lists emails in the specified folder with offset and limit.

parameters.folder_name: Folder to list emails from (INBOX, SENT, DRAFT, TRASH), defaults to INBOX
parameters.offset: Offset of the first email to return
parameters.limit: Maximum number of emails to return

email_move_email.description: Moves an email from one folder to another.

parameters.email_id: ID of the email to move
ID of the email to reply to
parameters.folder_name: Folder containing the original email, defaults to INBOX
parameters.cc: Additional cc recipients for the reply

email_search_emails.description: Searches for emails across folders based on a query string.

parameters.folder_name: Folder to search (INBOX, SENT, DRAFT, TRASH), defaults to INBOX

email_send_email.description: Sends an email to the specified recipients.

filesystem_get_file_info.description: Get information about a file or directory.

parameters.path: Path to the file or directory (relative to sandbox root)

filesystem_list_directory.description: List the contents of a directory.

parameters.path: Path to the directory (relative to sandbox root)

filesystem_read_file.description: Read the contents of a file.

parameters.path: Path to the file to read (relative to sandbox root)

finance-engine_get_price_history.description: Retrieves historical price data for a stock symbol over a specified time period. Returns a markdown table.

parameters.symbol: Stock ticker symbol (for example, AAPL, MSFT, GOOGL)
parameters.period: Look-back time period (1d, 5d, 1mo, 3mo, 6mo, 1y, 2y, 5y, 10y, ytd, max). Default 1mo.

finance-engine_get_ticker_info.description: Retrieves comprehensive stock data including company information, financials, trading metrics, and governance data.

finance-engine_get_top.description: Get top ETFs, mutual funds, or companies from a specific market sector.

parameters.sector: Market sector (for example, Technology, Healthcare, Energy)
parameters.top_type: Type of list: top_etfs, top_mutual_funds, top_companies, top_growth_companies, top_performing_companies

finance-engine_search_quotes.description: Searches for company quotes by query string using fuzzy matching.

parameters.query: Search query (company name or ticker symbol)

parameters.contains: Optional commit filter: branches that contain this
parameters.not_contains: Optional commit filter: branches that do not contain this

git_git_diff.description: Shows differences between branches or commits.

parameters.target: Target branch or commit to diff against

git_git_diff_staged.description: Shows changes that are staged for commit.

git_git_diff_unstaged.description: Shows changes in the working directory that are not yet staged.

parameters.max_count: Maximum number of commits to show

git_git_show.description: Shows the contents of a commit.

parameters.revision: Commit or object revision to show

linear_get_issue.description: Gets detailed information about a specific issue.

linear_get_issue_status.description: Gets detailed information about a specific issue status.

parameters.id: The ID of the issue status to retrieve
parameters.name: The name of the issue status to retrieve

linear_get_project.description: Gets detailed information about a specific project.

parameters.query: The ID or name of the project to retrieve

linear_get_team.description: Gets detailed information about a specific team.

parameters.query: The UUID, key, or name of the team to retrieve

linear_get_user.description: Gets detailed information about a specific user.

linear_list_comments.description: Lists all comments for a specific issue.

linear_list_cycles.description: Lists cycles for a specific team.

parameters.type: Which cycles to retrieve (current, previous, next)

linear_list_issue_labels.description: Lists issue labels in the workspace.

linear_list_issue_statuses.description: Lists issue statuses for a specific team.

linear_list_issues.description: Lists issues in the Linear workspace with optional filters.

parameters.assignee: Assignee to filter by (User ID, name, email, or 'me')
parameters.createdAt: Issues created on or after this ISO-8601 date-time or duration
parameters.label: Label name or ID
parameters.orderBy: Order in which to return results (createdAt, updatedAt)
parameters.query: Search in issue title or description
parameters.updatedAt: Issues updated on or after this ISO-8601 date-time or duration

linear_list_project_labels.description: Lists project labels in the workspace.

linear_list_projects.description: Lists all projects in the Linear workspace.

parameters.createdAt: Projects created on or after this ISO-8601 date-time or duration
parameters.member: Team member to filter by (User ID, name, email, or 'me')
parameters.updatedAt: Projects updated on or after this ISO-8601 date-time or duration

linear_list_teams.description: Lists all teams in the Linear workspace.

parameters.createdAt: Teams created on or after this ISO-8601 date-time or duration
parameters.updatedAt: Teams updated on or after this ISO-8601 date-time or duration

linear_list_users.description: Lists all users in the Linear workspace.

parameters.query: Optional query to filter users by name or email
parameters.team: Optional team ID to filter by membership

mcp-code-executor_append_to_code_file.description: Append content to an existing Python code file, to build larger code bases in parts.

mcp-code-executor_check_installed_packag.description: Check if packages are installed in the venv-uv environment.

mcp-code-executor_execute_code.description: Execute Python code in the venv-uv environment. For short snippets only.

mcp-code-executor_initialize_code_file.description: Create a new Python file with initial content.

mcp-code-executor_install_dependencies.description: Install Python dependencies in the venv-uv environment.

mcp-code-executor_read_code_file.description: Read the content of an existing Python code file.

mcp-server-code-runner_run-code.description: Run a code snippet and return the result.

memory_add_observations.description: Add new observations to existing entities in the knowledge graph.

memory_create_entities.description: Create multiple new entities in the knowledge graph.

memory_create_relations.description: Create multiple new relations between entities in the knowledge graph.

memory_delete_entities.description: Delete multiple entities and their associated relations from the knowledge graph.

memory_delete_observations.description: Delete specific observations from entities in the knowledge graph.

memory_delete_relations.description: Delete multiple relations from the knowledge graph.

memory_open_nodes.description: Open specific nodes in the knowledge graph by their names.

memory_search_nodes.description: Search for nodes in the knowledge graph based on a query.

messaging_add_user_to_conversation.description: Add a user to an existing conversation.

messaging_create_conversation.description: Create a new conversation with specified participants.

messaging_get_conversation.description: Get a conversation with its messages.

parameters.offset: Offset of first message to return
parameters.limit: Maximum number of messages to return

messaging_list_conversations.description: List conversations, sorted by last updated time.

parameters.offset: Offset of first conversation to return
parameters.limit: Maximum number of conversations to return

messaging_search_conversations.description: Search conversations by title, participant names, or message content.

parameters.limit: Maximum number of conversations to return

messaging_send_message.description: Send a message to the specified recipient. Creates or reuses a conversation.

messaging_send_message_to_conversation.description: Send a message to an existing conversation.

mongodb_aggregate.description: Run an aggregation against a MongoDB collection.

mongodb_collection-indexes.description: Describe the indexes for a collection.

mongodb_collection-schema.description: Describe the schema for a collection.

mongodb_collection-storage-size.description: Gets the storage size of the collection.

mongodb_count.description: Gets the number of documents in a MongoDB collection.

mongodb_create-index.description: Create an index for a collection.

mongodb_db-stats.description: Returns statistics that reflect the use state of a single database.

mongodb_explain.description: Returns statistics describing the execution of the winning plan chosen by the query optimizer.

mongodb_find.description: Run a find query against a MongoDB collection.

mongodb_list-collections.description: List all collections for a given database.

mongodb_list-databases.description: List all databases for a MongoDB connection.

mongodb_mongodb-logs.description: Returns the most recent logged mongod events.

mongodb_switch-connection.description: Switch to a different MongoDB connection.

notion_get-self.description: Get information about the current authenticated Notion user.

notion_get-user.description: Get a Notion user by ID.

notion_get-users.description: List all users in the workspace with pagination support.

notion_post-database-query.description: Query a database and return pages that match the filter criteria.

parameters.filter_properties: List of property IDs to include in response

notion_retrieve-a-block.description: Retrieve a Notion block by ID.

notion_retrieve-a-comment.description: Retrieve comments for a block or page. Returns empty list in mock server.

parameters.filter_properties: Optional list of property IDs to include

notion_retrieve-a-page-property.description: Retrieve a specific property value from a page.

office-excel_get_data_validation_info.description: Get all data validation rules in a worksheet.

office-excel_get_merged_cells.description: Get merged cells in a worksheet.

office-excel_get_workbook_metadata.description: Get metadata about workbook including sheets, ranges, etc.

office-excel_read_data_from_excel.description: Read data from Excel worksheet with cell metadata including validation rules.

parameters.preview_only: Whether to return only a preview

office-excel_validate_excel_range.description: Validate if a range exists and is properly formatted.

office-excel_validate_formula_syntax.description: Validate Excel formula syntax without applying it.

office-powerpoint_extract_presentation_t.description: Extract all text content from all slides in the presentation.

office-powerpoint_extract_slide_text.description: Extract all text content from a specific slide.

office-powerpoint_get_server_info.description: Get information about the PowerPoint MCP server.

office-powerpoint_get_slide_info.description: Get information about a specific slide.

office-powerpoint_get_template_file_info.description: Get information about a template file including layouts and properties.

office-powerpoint_get_template_info.description: Get detailed information about a specific template.

office-powerpoint_list_slide_templates.description: List all available slide layout templates.

office-powerpoint_manage_slide_masters.description: Access and manage slide master properties and layouts.

parameters.layout_index: Index of specific layout within master (0-based)

office-powerpoint_open_presentation.description: Open an existing PowerPoint presentation from a file.

office-powerpoint_switch_presentation.description: Switch to a different loaded presentation.

office-word_find_text_in_document.description: Find occurrences of specific text in a Word document.

parameters.whole_word: Whether to match whole words only

office-word_get_all_comments.description: Extract all comments from a Word document.

office-word_get_comments_by_author.description: Extract comments from a specific author in a Word document.

office-word_get_comments_for_paragraph.description: Extract comments for a specific paragraph in a Word document.

office-word_get_document_info.description: Get information about a Word document.

office-word_get_document_outline.description: Get the structure of a Word document.

office-word_get_document_text.description: Extract all text from a Word document.

office-word_get_document_xml.description: Get the raw XML structure of a Word document.

office-word_get_paragraph_text_from_docu.description: Get text from a specific paragraph in a Word document.

office-word_list_available_documents.description: List all .docx files in the specified directory.

office-word_validate_document_footnotes.description: Validate all footnotes in document for coherence and compliance.

quickbooks_get_bill.description: Retrieve a single bill by ID from QuickBooks.

quickbooks_get_customer.description: Retrieve a single customer by ID from QuickBooks.

quickbooks_get_vendor.description: Retrieve a single vendor by ID from QuickBooks.

quickbooks_read_invoice.description: Retrieve a single invoice by its ID from QuickBooks.

quickbooks_search_accounts.description: Search for accounts in QuickBooks using flexible criteria.

quickbooks_search_bills.description: Search for bills in QuickBooks using flexible criteria.

quickbooks_search_customers.description: Search for customers in QuickBooks using flexible criteria.

quickbooks_search_invoices.description: Search for invoices in QuickBooks using criteria object with limit/offset inside criteria.

quickbooks_search_vendors.description: Search for vendors in QuickBooks using flexible criteria.

reminder_get_all_reminders.description: Get all the reminders from the reminder system.

shopping_cancel_order.description: Cancel an order that is not yet delivered.

shopping_checkout.description: Checkout the order and create a new order from the current cart contents. Optional strict discount code support.

parameters.discount_code: Optional discount code to apply to entire order

shopping_get_all_discount_codes.description: Returns all the discount codes that are available with the items they apply to.

shopping_get_discount_code_info.description: Takes the discount code and returns the applicable items with their discount percentages.

shopping_get_product_details.description: Get product details for a given product id.

shopping_list_all_products.description: List all products in the catalog with pagination.

shopping_search_product.description: Search for a product in the inventory by its name.

parameters.product_name: Name of the product to search for

parameters.limit: Maximum number of channels to return

slack_conversations_add_message.description: Add a message to a public channel, private channel, or DM by channel_id and thread_ts.

slack_conversations_history.description: Get messages from the channel (or DM) by channel_id, with cursor-based pagination.

parameters.limit: Maximum number of messages to return

slack_conversations_replies.description: Get a thread of messages posted to a conversation by channelID and thread_ts.

parameters.limit: Maximum number of messages to return

slack_conversations_search_messages.description: Search messages in a conversation using filters. All filters optional if search_query is provided.

weather_airquality.description: Get air quality for a location.

weather_alerts.description: Get weather alerts for a location.

weather_astronomy.description: Get astronomy data (sunrise, sunset, moon) for a date.

weather_forecast_future.description: Get future weather forecast for a latitude/longitude location for dates 14+ days in the future.

weather_history.description: Get historical weather for a lat,long location on a given date.

weather_sports.description: Get sports events (for example, football, cricket) for a location.

weather_timezone.description: Get timezone info for a location.

zendesk_get-agents.description: Get all agents in the system with page-based pagination.

parameters.limit: Number of agents per page (max 100, default 100)
parameters.sort_by: Field to sort by (id, name, email, created_at)

zendesk_get-my-tickets.description: Get tickets assigned to a specific user (typically the current user).

parameters.limit: Number of tickets per page (max 100, default 100)
parameters.sort_by: Field to sort by (id, created_at, updated_at, priority, status, due_at)
parameters.sort_order: Sort order (asc or desc, default desc)

zendesk_get-tags.description: Get all unique tags used across all tickets, with usage counts.

zendesk_get-ticket.description: Retrieve a single ticket by its ID.

parameters.ticket_id: ID of the ticket to retrieve

zendesk_get-ticket-comments.description: Get comments for a ticket with pagination.

parameters.limit: Number of comments per page (max 100, default 100)
parameters.sort_order: Sort order (asc or desc, default asc)

zendesk_get-tickets.description: List tickets with page-based pagination, filtering, sorting, and search.

parameters.limit: Number of tickets per page (max 100, default 100)
parameters.status: Filter by status (new, open, pending, on-hold, solved, closed)
parameters.priority: Filter by priority (low, normal, high, urgent)
parameters.type: Filter by type (problem, incident, question, task)
parameters.sort_by: Sort field (id, created_at, updated_at, priority, status, due_at)
parameters.sort_order: Sort order (asc or desc, default desc)

zendesk_get-tickets-by-tag.description: Get all tickets that have a specific tag.

parameters.limit: Number of tickets per page (max 100, default 100)
parameters.sort_by: Field to sort by (id, created_at, updated_at, priority, status, due_at)
parameters.sort_order: Sort order (asc or desc, default desc)

zendesk_get-unassigned-tickets.description: Get tickets that have no assignee.

parameters.limit: Number of tickets per page (max 100, default 100)
parameters.sort_by: Field to sort by (id, created_at, updated_at, priority, status, due_at)
parameters.sort_order: Sort order (asc or desc, default desc)

zendesk_get-user.description: Get a single user by their ID.

parameters.user_id: ID of the user to retrieve

zendesk_get-users.description: List all users with page-based pagination, filtering, and sorting.

parameters.limit: Number of users per page (max 100, default 100)
parameters.sort_by: Field to sort by (id, name, email, role, created_at, updated_at)
parameters.sort_order: Sort order (asc or desc, default asc)
